text: and it's why we started this journey
together nearly eight months ago on a
frigid January day remember that one
just a short distance from here in front
of our house in Brooklyn that day we
said that New York had become a tale of
two cities one where the very wealthy
had not only rebounded from the great
recession but where life couldn't get
much better for them and we acknowledged
that day that there was another New York
a New York were nearly half our citizens
are living at or near the poverty line
where luxury condos had replaced
Community Hospital's we're proactive
policing had somehow slipped quietly
into racial profiling where too many
mothers and fathers feared that their
daughters and sons would never achieve
the very thing we want most for our kids
that they get the education they need to
pave the way for a better life and
policing policies that single out young
people of color a stop-and-frisk era
that in many ways make both communities
and the police less safe that isn't a
New York we can allow to continue
it's a risk that we as a city cannot
afford to take let's recommit ourselves
to the movement that got us here to
begin with
a commitment to giving every child of
our city the chance they deserve a
promise to speak the truth no matter who
tries to twist our words or dampen our
spirits we've moved forward with a sense
of mission a cause greater than
ourselves a dedication to lifting up the
lives of every New Yorker we know we
know that New York City is the greatest
city on earth and not simply because of
our economic might or our stunning
skyline or our vibrant culture but
because we are a city that leads the
nation that leads the world in
remembering that we are bigger we are
stronger we are better as a city when we
make sure that everyone has a shot
